title.narrative: OUTPUT 7.7: PROGRAMME PLANNING, MONITORING AND Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers (HACT)

description.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively plan and monitor programmes. Increased capacity of government and partners to effectively monitor programme implementation in compliance with Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers (HACT). , which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country Programmes are efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

UNITED NATIONS RELIEF AND WORKS AGENCY FOR PALESTINE REFUGEES IN THE NEAR EAST

sector.narrative: Field Monitoring including humanitarian performance monitoring

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively plan and monitor programmes. Increased capacityof government and partners to effectively monitor programme implementation in compliance with HACT.

description.narrative: Overall, the targets for this output were met in 2021. Key highlights include the completion of the minimum number of required programmatic visits and spot checks, ensuring effective monitoring of programme activities. During the year, the standard operating procedure (SOP) and budget template for civil society organization (CSO) partnerships were revised and simplified. Several training sessions on eTools were conducted to ensure optimal utilization of the system, and this was in addition regular technical support provided during the year. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:14/01/2022
